text: Hey <@UDFTHC6PK> We don’t have a great material on this yet admittedly.  If you’d like, I’d be happy to set up some time for for us to chat (either in real time or over slack) to help introduce you to some of things you aren’t familiar with so I can use that to create better getting started docs

Was just circling back on this; apologies for the delayed response, <@UDFTHC6PK>! Zack will be an excellent resource and if you have other clarifying questions, feel free to post here or on the Community (where I’m a bit more active).
Hey, <@UGXQK1B7Y>. Correct. The production key you want is located in *Settings* > *Integrations* > *API key*!

hey <@UDFTHC6PK> for your first question, keeping the key private, you probably wouldn't want to have the API key available in the file manager. If you're using it with an app, the best solution is to use an environment variable and gitignore that file, that way you can commit and share your code without exposing the key.

if that's not your use-case, feel free to reach out and I'll help where I can
